cleaned.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17

raw.title: [BIP-741] Grant V3 Permissions to Maxis and Emergency DAO Multisigs
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
As per [BIP-734](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-734-balancer-v3-launch-and-protocol-enhancements/6168), Balancer V3 contracts have successfully been deployed to Ethereum and Gnosis! In order to both (1) call emergency functions (2) manage pool settings, it is proposed that the following existing multisigs are granted the following roles by the authorizer:

## Emergency DAO

- `VaultAdmin.pauseVault`
- `VaultAdmin.unpauseVault`
- `VaultAdmin.pausePool`
- `VaultAdmin.unpausePool`
- `VaultAdmin.pauseVaultBuffers`
- `VaultAdmin.unpauseVaultBuffers`
- `VaultAdmin.enableRecoveryMode`
- `VaultAdmin.disableRecoveryMode`
- `VaultAdmin.enableQuery`
- `VaultAdmin.disableQuery`
- `VaultAdmin.disableQueryPermanently`
- `StablePoolFactory.disable`
- `WeightedPoolFactory.disable`

## Maxis

- `VaultAdmin.setStaticSwapFeePercentage`
- `StablePool.startAmplificationParameterUpdate`
- `StablePool.stopAmplificationParameterUpdate`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFees`
- `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFeesForToken`

# Payload

The required payload can be found [on our GitHub repo](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1535) and can be summarised as follows:
```
+-----------------------+---------------------+--------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----+----------+
```

cleaned.title: [BIP-778] Grant Maxis StableSurge Parameter Change Permissions
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-778] Grant Maxis StableSurge Parameter Change Permissions
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
PR with payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1755

### Summary & Motivation

The [StableSurge](https://medium.com/balancer-protocol/balancers-stablesurge-hook-09d2eb20f219) hook has been deployed by the Balancer Labs team marking an exciting milestone for Balancer V3 as the first wave of hooks are hitting production. With these innovations come additional permissions related to the management of each hooks unique parameters. In the case of StableSurge the maxSurgeFeePercentage and surgeThresholdPercentage are key factors in determining how the hook will affect the pool performance and the liquidity providers. This proposal will act to grant the permissions to change both of these parameters to the Balancer Maxis on all currently deployed networks, Ethereum Mainnet, Gnosis, Arbitrum, and Base.

**Technical Specification:**

All deployments and action-ids can be verified in this StableSurgePoolFactory [pull request](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/pull/163/files#diff-17e7d1b01753c19be2eee514c14e09736db3af94d24025c7fd9876c73b6e7950).

**Ethereum**

On Mainnet the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Arbitrum**

On Arbitrum the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x261258d23af1013ceb3a0574a5f194e3d4d09a07c0b9014665519c3f1b37f792`, `0x5968f4b1f98171ccadc78df4f25cf8262b250f2f12a83c45b7311b4674d23e0a`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Base**

On Base the Balancer DAO Multisig `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0xe81edd4ccc5901443972e580b5d997ced38f33bd4f7e9bca8829dc5efcca6fed`, `0x4a7d099f7d634af69cf552b5b1c76ed8d44074051cbca5a59b842154288b96f1`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

**Gnosis**

On Gnosis the Balancer DAO Multisig `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRoles` passing: [`0x2f27aa67b6bf44b4441ea2656c22e09252261845a98dc577a6fc06b6526f8bcc`, `0x66c657ea0d5ce1dc0286795937131c61620bb6ccd0f126fbfe3799d8b89a9753`] for roles, and account Maxi omni-chain multisig: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e`

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-308] Enable Layer Zero Cross chain Boosts
cleaned.author: 0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3

raw.title: [BIP-308] Enable Layer Zero Cross chain Boosts
raw.author: 0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3
raw.body:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/211

### Motivation

Balancer and Layer Zero contributors have recently completed development and testing of bridging veBAL boosts cross chain. Now that the final version of the contracts have been deployed governance must grant certain permissions for the system to function properly.

### Specification


[details="Ethereum"]

1.
The DAO Multisig `eth:0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xaecef2a08acfa6437c6cad5d0aad2bd0172fec6050bd95d13aa5450c25aaa391`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setOmniVotingEscrow` on the `OmniVotingEscrowAdaptor`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#LL1323C42-L1323C108). 

account: `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`

This grants the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.

2. 
The DAO Multisig `eth:0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the OmniVotingEscrowAdaptor `0x96484f2aBF5e58b15176dbF1A799627B53F13B6d` calling `setOmniVotingEscrow` with the following argument:

`0xE241C6e48CA045C7f631600a0f1403b2bFea05ad` 

which corresponds to LZ's [OmniVotingEscrow](https://etherscan.io/address/0xe241c6e48ca045c7f631600a0f1403b2bfea05ad) contract. 

3.
The DAO Multisig `eth:0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xaecef2a08acfa6437c6cad5d0aad2bd0172fec6050bd95d13aa5450c25aaa391`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setOmniVotingEscrow` on the `OmniVotingEscrowAdaptor`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#LL1323C42-L1323C108). 

account: `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`

This removes the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.
[/details]

[details="Gnosis"]

1.
The DAO Multisig `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x61d367fdef9a156d543288bab90410760d120019702b0559ffb08a3075aa7d42`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/gnosis/action-ids.json#LL379C36-L379C102). 

account: `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18`

This grants the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.

2. 
The DAO Multisig `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the l2-ve-delegation-proxy `0x7A2535f5fB47b8e44c02Ef5D9990588313fe8F05` calling `setDelegation` with the following argument:

`0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd` 

which corresponds to the [l2-veboost-v2](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/addresses/gnosis.json#LL415C21-L415C63) contract. 

3.
The DAO Multisig `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x61d367fdef9a156d543288bab90410760d120019702b0559ffb08a3075aa7d42`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/gnosis/action-ids.json#LL379C36-L379C102). 

account: `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18`

This removes the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.
[/details]
[details="Polygon"]

1.
The DAO Multisig `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xd2a18eaab6c28631d421edd953f276d757b0a3c5f5460535105596ed38d938d4`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/polygon/action-ids.json#LL665C36-L665C102). 

account: `0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85`

This grants the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.

2. 
The DAO Multisig `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the l2-ve-delegation-proxy `0x0f08eEf2C785AA5e7539684aF04755dEC1347b7c` calling `setDelegation` with the following argument:

`0xD961E30156C2E0D0d925A0De45f931CB7815e970` 

which corresponds to the [l2-veboost-v2](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/addresses/polygon.json#LL664C21-L664C63) contract. 

3.
The DAO Multisig `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xd2a18eaab6c28631d421edd953f276d757b0a3c5f5460535105596ed38d938d4`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/polygon/action-ids.json#LL665C36-L665C102). 

account: `0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85`

This removes the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.
[/details]
[details="Arbitrum"]

1.
The DAO Multisig `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xab668cacffdf6f785bcac395e15f5f5b4b109b0320004b24c7c39937e71d585c`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#LL612C36-L612C102). 

account: `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0`

This grants the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.

2. 
The DAO Multisig `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the l2-ve-delegation-proxy `0x81cFAE226343B24BA12EC6521Db2C79E7aeeb310` calling `setDelegation` with the following argument:

`0x6B5dA774890Db7B7b96C6f44e6a4b0F657399E2e` 

which corresponds to the [l2-veboost-v2](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/addresses/arbitrum.json#LL673C21-L673C63) contract. 

3.
The DAO Multisig `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xab668cacffdf6f785bcac395e15f5f5b4b109b0320004b24c7c39937e71d585c`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#LL612C36-L612C102). 

account: `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0`

This removes the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.
[/details]
[details="Optimism"]

1.
The DAO Multisig `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x17391f0660d4c41d3e09aeb10b8c06f82f48919ea50dbfe36aaed62ad681d8eb`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/optimism/action-ids.json#LL530C36-L530C102). 

account: `0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc`

This grants the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.

2. 
The DAO Multisig `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the l2-ve-delegation-proxy `0x9dA18982a33FD0c7051B19F0d7C76F2d5E7e017c` calling `setDelegation` with the following argument:

`0x6817149cb753BF529565B4D023d7507eD2ff4Bc0` 

which corresponds to the [l2-veboost-v2](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/addresses/optimism.json#LL584C21-L584C63) contract. 

3.
The DAO Multisig `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x17391f0660d4c41d3e09aeb10b8c06f82f48919ea50dbfe36aaed62ad681d8eb`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/optimism/action-ids.json#LL530C36-L530C102).

This removes the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.
[/details]

raw.title: [BIP-500] Root gauges bridge settings
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/672

Arbitrum and Optimism root gauges contain internal settings related to the cost of bridging BAL incentives minted on Mainnet to the corresponding liquidity gauges on Arbitrum/Optimism.

This proposal aims to grant to Balancer Maxis the role to manage those settings, so as to be able to tune them according to network conditions.

# Specification

From the Balancer DAO Governance Multisig (`0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`):

* Call `grantRoles` on the `Authorizer` (`0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6`) with:
  * roles: `[0xd5799f5a62cdbcebada0c4ff21f7a0d82cfc1ad293c79f597c27bd1c03ad100b, 0x6a625c2e350a93dad2713c2fa449ec9304288897f8b7ad89c21417b9020eb99e]` ([source](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L751), [source](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L760))
  * account: `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860`

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-749] Grant `add_reward` Permissions to Maxis’ Omnichain Multisig
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-749] Grant `add_reward` Permissions to Maxis’ Omnichain Multisig
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
# PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1612

# Motivation

The action of whitelisting a custom reward token on a gauge is permissioned. Doing it through the DAO multisig for every partner/gauge/token is not feasible, hence [BIP-387](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-387-give-balancer-maxis-ability-to-add-3rd-party-rewards-to-mainnet-gauges/5018) requested permission for calling `add_reward` through the authorizer from the Maxis’ multisig.

The Maxis are however in the process of migrating their multisig to the so-called omnichain multisig, a multisig that has the same address on all chains. Over time it will replace the old one. In a lot of cases it already has replaced it; this permission is one of the last things that keeps the Maxis from moving over fully.

# Specification

On Ethereum, the DAO multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will call `grantRole(bytes32,address)` on the authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` with the following arguments:

* role: `0x3bf29175652a3f0fac5abb715d0b7fe2e7b597e2e2eff555dac6b21a20a7c83e` ([ref](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L714C41-L714C107))
* account: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e` ([ref](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/bal_addresses/blob/78e701eeca6d376b43a80684b5cfec50df0a971a/extras/multisigs.json#L11C19-L11C61))

It will perform the same action on all other chains where the omnichain multisig is deployed and does not have these permissions yet: Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, Gnosis, Optimism and Polygon.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal seeks to grant multisig roles to Balancer maxis for managing the new Balancer Contract Registry across multiple chains, enabling streamlined contract management. Voting timeline shows unanimous support, and similar past proposals passed with similar intent. Forum sentiment is neutral but discussion is limited and clarifying.
key_arguments_for: Unanimous voting support throughout all voting quartiles indicates strong consensus.
The proposal enables efficient management of Balancer v3 contracts via multisig role grants.
Similar past proposals with operational role grants passed successfully.
Market shows slight TVL increase, indicating stability.
key_arguments_against: Post-vote token price showed minor declines in similar proposals, suggesting cautious optimism.
Forum sentiment is neutral and does not actively endorse the change.

evidence.quote: Forum comments are neutral with no positive or negative sentiment; discussion focused on clarifying Arbitrum permissions.
Timeline metrics show lead ratio 1.0 for 'Yes, let's do it' with strong stability and early vote ratio.
Adjacent proposals [BIP-785], [BIP-784], [BIP-783] similarly enabled new features and roles, all passed with 'Yes' votes but saw minor post-vote price declines.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Voting timeline metrics show unanimous and stable support for the 'Yes, let's do it' option, indicating strong consensus.
- Forum sentiment is neutral, showing no opposition but limited active support; the recommendation aligns with vote data but slightly diverges from community sentiment.
- Similar past proposals enabling operational roles passed successfully, suggesting this change is beneficial despite minor token price declines post-vote.
- Market impact shows slight TVL increase, supporting the proposal's positive operational impact on the protocol.
